page.title: 06Glanaman C.P. School.
page.content: Glanaman School celebrated its centenary year in 1984 and the school has seen many changes, both structural and curricular, during its history. Pupils between the ages of 5 and 11 are taught by 5 teachers. As well as receiving bilingual education in academic subjects, pupils are encouraged to take part in a wide variety of sports and games, such as netball, rugby and swimming. In addition, most pupils have the opportunity of attending field weeks at the environmental centre at Pendine as well as taking part in various local studies and school outings. Pupils are provided with school dinners prepared on the premises, (current price 65pence per day) or they may opt to bring in their own packed lunch.
